title: Manager, Systems Engineering
content:
Agility Robotics is a pioneer. Our robot, Digit, is the first to be sold into workplaces across the globe. Our team is differentiated by its expertise in imagining, engineering, and delivering robots with advanced mobility, dexterity, intelligence, and efficiency -- robots specifically designed to work alongside people, in spaces built for people. Every day, we break through engineering challenges and invent new solutions and capabilities that will one day make robots commonplace and approachable. This work is our passion and our responsibility: our mission is to make businesses more productive and people’s lives more fulfilling.About the Role 
Serve as the Systems Engineering manager and work with hardware, software, applications, systems, industrial and manufacturing engineering teams to develop and deliver high-performance, industry-leading robots. This individual will lead Engineering teams to develop robust Systems Engineering and Test capabilities by building a talented team, developing scalable systems engineering processes, and fostering effective communication across the organization.
About the Work 

       Lead the development, coordination, and growth of the company’s systems engineering workforce
       Responsible for the management of the Systems Engineering and integration team members, and our systems engineering principles and best practices
       Responsible for overall product architecture and system performance

o   Serve as a the engineering product leader within the engineering organization

       Champion of Systems Engineering at Agility

o   Systems Architecture Management
o   Requirements Development / Verification / Validation
o   Interface and Resource Management
o   Failure and Fault Management Response
o   Ensure System design meets Safety requirements
o   Ensure System design meets Compliance requirements
o   Ensure System design is reliable, failure modes are understood, and design mitigations are in place 

       Maintain Systems Engineering best practices while building company process, tools, and standards
       Grow a team with diverse technical backgrounds
       Interface and direct cross functional project teams across engineering and the business
       Support business development efforts and new business opportunities
       Work closely with Manufacturing, Production, Operations, and Sales teams
       Provide systems engineering leadership for testing activities

About You
The successful candidate should be an excellent coach, mentor, communicator, and leader and have:

Bachelor’s degree in an engineering/science/robotics or related field 
10+ years of relevant experience working with complex products
5+ years of leadership experience in hardware, electrical or electromechanical systems and products
Experience as a technical lead or other demonstrated leadership role related to program execution on a new development program
Experience in complex new system development with safety and compliance requirements (e.g., automotive, aerospace, medical, consumer electronic wearables, or similar)
Effective communication skills and demonstrated success in a team environment
 Strong analytical and problem solving skills
 Prior experience managing systems engineering, test, and validation
Demonstrated ability to work across disciplines to build consensus and drive complex systems to completion
Ability to drive team success through technical direction and empowerment
Experience in HAZID, HAZOP, FMEA/FMECA, Fault/Success Tree, and other Hazard Identification and Fault Management tools
 Experience in requirements definition and flow down, management, validation, and verification practice
 Experience with or leveraging information from system modeling tools in the support of system definition and requirements development
Experience with sub-system and interface definition, both internal to a company and with vendors or subcontractors, in support of concurrent engineering development
Robotics experience and leadership in robotics organization
Advanced degree in engineering/science/robotics preferred
Experience with agile development
Jira/Confluence experience
Smartsheet or similar experience
Reliance or similar software experience
Doors / JAMA or similar software experience

 Benefits 

Competitive Compensation Package
100% Company Paid Disability, Life, Health, Dental & Vision Insurance (for AR employees)
Employer Matched Retirement Plan
Five Weeks of Paid Time Off Annually
Paid Parental Leave
Tuition Reimbursement
Employee Referral Bonus Program
Relocation Assistance (for certain roles)
Stock Options (for certain roles)
A culture that encourages flexible work schedules
A culture that embraces individuality and authenticity

Agility Robotics is committed to a work environment in which all individuals are treated with respect and dignity. Each individual has the right to work in a professional atmosphere that promotes equal employment opportunities and prohibits unlawful discriminatory practices, including harassment. Therefore, it is the policy of Agility Robotics to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, marital status, citizenship, national origin, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Agility Robotics prohibits any such discrimination or harassment.
